Review Title: Wonderful modern hotel with a great location
Negative Reviews: The doors to the buildings are not automatic and you have to manually open them.  In our building there was an outer and inner door very close together. I think this improves security, but it made entry and exit with large luggage difficult. However, it appeared that most of the nearby buildings and other hotels we experienced there also had manual doors. There were also several spots that contained multi-level steps in the hallway on the way to our room. Also a bit difficult to navigate large luggage, but there was an elevator in the building so it was not a major issue. All their buildings had entryway stairs with no ramps.  Someone with limited mobility may have more difficulty staying here, but for us the quality of the hotel and its amenities made this just a minor inconvenience.
Positive Reviews: The location of the hotel was very convenient and a short walk from the Earl's Court station.  We stayed in a double room in the 24 Penywern Rd building, which was right next to their main building where you check in.  I didn't realize it when I booked it, but the room had 2 double beds in a suite-type set-up, which worked out just fine. Rooms were very modern and updated with sensor lighting and controls. Although somewhat small (possibly due to the 2 double beds), there was plenty of room to relax, sleep, and stay.  The toiletry amenities and in-room coffee set up and fridge were a plus, especially since most hotels no longer offer such perks.  Room was clean and the linens and towels were great quality, and the bed was very comfortable.  We did not purchase the breakfast with our reservation, but we were able to purchase breakfast separately on arrival. The breakfast was worth it in my opinion, and had a good selection of hot and cold offerings.  Staff was very polite and helpful.  Would definitely stay here again on our next trip to London.

Negative Reviews: The floor was wet near the bathroom and didn’t get rectified.
Breakfast with weak filter coffee

The location was very convenient to public transport. I travelled on the Piccadilly line from Heathrow airport. At Earl's Court Station there is a lift from the platform level to the ground level (convenient with luggage).and the hotel is  a few minutes walk away. 
In addition to the Piccadilly line there is the District line and buses so it is easy to reach the center of London.
 I took the bus to Victoria train station which was even more convenient.
There are many restaurants, supermarkets, pubs and a pharmacy nearby.
The room was a Deluxe double room (for single use).
I requested a room on a high floor, near the elevator with a walk in shower and received exactly what I reserved. The size of the room was  a good size for London.
The room was modern, clean, with air-condition, had a safe and a small refrigerator that was very useful. 
The bed was comfortable.
The breakfast buffet was good.

Location was great next to earl's court subway station so convenient , on the picadilly line so you can go straight to the airport ,the rooms were very clean small but it was ok we booked 2 kind of rooms

note that you can be in a separate building than the reception so I would suggest to check in before carrying your bags up the small stairs.
we arrived early and we had to store our bags in the reception area .
some of the staff were warm and welcoming and some were just courteous, I didnt expect friendliness so expectations were low already :D
honestly was expecting the worst when reading the reviews and I am someone who's critical , but it wasn't bad at all and it was too late for me to change my booking , I didn't regret staying here after all

Review Title: It was ok in the end
Negative Reviews:
We paid for a deluxe room. 
The first room we were put in had an awful smell of sewage so we called down to reception and asked if they could move us. They did so, but the second room they gave us had a small double bed that folded down from the wall. The mattress was uncomfortable and the metal frame and unstable legs were super creaky. Unacceptable for the price we paid. You do not book a deluxe room and expect to be put on a fold down mattress. 

Eventually we were moved again and were upgraded. 
The original room would have been absolutely fine had it not smelt like the toilet.

The room was very tiny. Much smaller than I expected and barely managed to fit two boxes. 
The staff did not attempt to offer us an early check in although that may be because they were fully booked as a lot of luggage was in the lobby. There are two (close-by) locations on this street so make sure to go to the one with the lobby before heaving your boxes up a flight of stairs (the stairs were just a few though but still save the hassle)
Positive Reviews:
The location was very convenient to Earl's Court station. Stayed only one day so I didn't explore the neighbourhood.
We could store our luggage prior to check in and the staff graciously allowed a late check out on request. All in all not bad for a one night stay and great access to transit

Review Title: Perfect for visitors wanting to be close to public transport.

Location

Negative Reviews:
We had requested a twin room as I was travelling with my sister and had confirmation of this on our booking form. On accessing our room we had been given a double bed. The reception staff denied receiving the instruction but then said we'd been upgraded to a bigger room (as though this should make it OK) and there was nothing he could do. Eventually he agreed to change this to twin beds for the remaining nights of our stay which they did. It's not a big deal (but could be depending who you're travelling with) but I don't expect to have to argue about it.
Regarding the room lighting - the bedside lighting system is far too bright, so the room is very light at night. There was no way to dim it.
Positive Reviews: The location of this hotel is excellent. Earls Court station is just around the corner and there are plenty of restaurants and cafes close by. The rooms are of a good size, very clean and serviced well. We arrived early and they kept our cases for us which was helpful.

Positive Reviews: The location of the hotel was great right near earls court station, which gives you easy access to most tourist sites in London. Hotel staff were nice, and the room was always cleaned. Our room has a great bathroom very large shower.
Clean

Negative Reviews:
Would like more biscuits to have with cuppas ;-)

The tv also only worked on 1 channel which is a bit odd for such a nice hotel.

Close to train stations.

Review Title: Worth considering but not if you can’t manage stairs.
Negative Reviews:
There were no Ramps for us to pull our suitcases up the stairs to reception. It was only stairs. There was a lift thankfully up to our rooms but it is tiny. The stairs up to our room are very narrow. One day we had been out all day and were very tired and when we finally got to our room it was being cleaned and we were told to come back in 20 mins which we then had to go and sit in the nearest pub and wait.
Also our air conditioning didn’t work in one of the rooms and then the other room was freezing.
Also the suite was very small and we had no where to store our 4 suitcases so we had to leave them standing up and when we wanted something from them we had to lay them down,get our stuff out and then stand them back up again.
Also the free water bottles didn’t get replenished at all.
Positive Reviews: It had a great location right on Earls court station and there were heaps of restaurants near by and souvenir shops. The area is very nice and felt safe walking around. The M&S food on the corner was very handy. The hotel was modern with key card entry and each of our rooms had windows to look out. It was serviced and cleaned everyday which was a blessing travelling with 4 people.

Negative Reviews: Room is bit small, not a lot of storage.

Great location, near stores and tube station.

Man at reception, same one on all three occasions I had to go there. He was not a very good example of good customer service.   Did the bare minimum each time. Point deducted from review for this. First impression given by staff really counts. 
Room 117 faced out onto the street so certain amount of noise. Also situated beside the lift so could hear the movement of this every time. Small things that didn't bother me too much but important for others to know.

GREAT location and very clean! The beds were comfortable and we had an upgrade free of charge. There is definitely nicer hotels to stay but this one was great for the price! :)

The only issue we had was the room location, it was right next to the lift so we experienced the noise of the lift and opening and closing of the lift door which caused us to wake up earlier than planned.

Positive Reviews:

I would add that I would not pay £26 per head for the breakfast, if it had not been included in the price. The staff were all helpful, some better than others, but fair. We were extremely lucky with the weather which helps, - 28 degrees and sunny - who would had thought that the air con would be such a bonus!! - In London to attend Buckingham Palace tour [Very Good] and Shania Twain at the 02 - [Excellent]

Negative Reviews:
Air con stopped working on the first night. I mentioned this to reception and was told it would be checked by housekeeping. Made 2 calls to reception the second night when London was in an unexpected heatwave... the air con was showing an error so was provided with a portable air conditioner. Asked at reception again after breakfast what the status was as I was told an electrician would need to check it. They offered me a different room so had to pack everything up before heading out and thankfully third night was very comfortable. Room was much bigger too.

I had a standard double room and found it a little small as a solo traveller so might be a bit cramped for couples. Sink was tiny too. But the upgraded room was perfect size wise. Wish I had booked that one originally.

Breakfast was ok. The pastries seemed stale and therefore not freshly baked that morning. Not many vegetarian/vegan options.
Positive Reviews: Amazing location. So easy to get around from the hotel. Managed to see and do so much. Rooms are very modern and high-tech. Breakfast room is very relaxing, pretty interiors. The controls by the bed were amazing... when they worked. At the press of a button, your door would show a 'Do not disturb' symbol! And you could control the room temperature and lights too.

Tube / supermarket / cafes / restaurants were only a short walk away. It felt safe overall.

Very comfortable bed.

Review Title: Excellent place to sleep, perfectly located next to the subway
Negative Reviews: The only real downside of the tiny rooms is that there's no real place to put the luggage, nor any hanger for the small towel in the bathroom, but that was certainly tolerable. Slightly confusing to myself and many other visitors I witnessed first walking to No. 12's door, which is labeled with the hotel name on the awning but isn't actually the reception. No. 16's awning is only labeled 16, but that's the hotel's reception.
Positive Reviews:
The Deluxe Single Room was tiny, but big enough for my needs, as was the quite large single bed. The mattress was nice and firm without being too stiff, and the 4 pillows were not super tall.
The location of the hotel is right next to the Earl's Court subway station, so it was perfect for my needs since I travel everywhere by subway.
The shower stall was the first one I've ever used in my 20 years of travels, where there was NO water on the bathroom floor after a shower. I wish all hotels used these stalls.
My room's window faced the street, and was perfectly quiet, despite the elevator being next door and the subway station being below. Being on the 2nd floor probably helped with that, I suppose.

Review Title: A utilitarian hotel very well situated to visit London for a few days
Negative Reviews: Tiny tiny bathroom and proximity to the station means it is noisy, you can hear every train arrive as it breaks to a stop. Air conditioning and bathroom noises super high too. Average breakfast. Indifferent staff.
Positive Reviews: Good location, near Earls Court. Nice size, clean bedroom, comfortable bed.

Negative Reviews: Bed could have been more comfortable
Positive Reviews: Great location very clean and modern.

Review Title: I would definitely return to this hotel.
Negative Reviews: The room is quite small.
Positive Reviews: The room is very clean bed comfortable room decoration is new and the area is superb. Very close to underground station, several local pubs and restaurants nearby and most importantly it's very safe neighborhood.

Great hotel at a good location near the tubestation
Breakfast is great as well

Negative Reviews: Room could have been a little bigger.
Positive Reviews: It is very close to the metro station, grocery store, restaurants and the lovely Chelsea area.  The room was renovated and was very high tech.

Review Title: Modern and nice location, however clean the room is not good
Negative Reviews: AC is either always on or always off, you can not control it, cleaning is not good
Positive Reviews: Modern rooms and good location

Negative Reviews: There was a wall in bedroom which was really from people who rested their  league around it. I thought,  for the price a d quality of the hotel, this is not acceptable.

Negative Reviews: split buildings

Negative Reviews: Very small room, small bed, not really comfortable; ok for 1 night if you are out the whole day but not more than that

Negative Reviews: Rooms very small
Positive Reviews: clean, comfortable, a walk-in shower. Great location

Review Title: Great location but some small improvements could have made the stay more comfortable.
Negative Reviews: The twins beds were very hard and uncomfortable. Also the towels were thin and hard.
Positive Reviews: Excellent location, very close to Earls Court tube and on a quiet street. Rooms were compact but modern, nicely decorated and clean and had everything you needed.

Review Title: Great location, Pleasant Staff. Good facilities but somewhat claustrophobic.
Negative Reviews:
Hats off to the interior designer who managed to shoehorn all the facilities into such a small space. It is sadly accepted that you don't get too many square metres of floor space for your dollar in London but this was verging on the ridiculous. It took some very careful planning and coordination for two people to be vertical at the same time.
There was, a dressing table and chair but the close proximity of the bed prevented the use of the chair, rendering it to nothing more than an ornament. I think when you are paying in excess of £250 per night, it is not unreasonable to expect to be able to circumnavigate the room without the constant fear of breaking one's toes.
Positive Reviews: Visiting Wimbledon, so location was excellent. Around the corner from Earls Court underground station, just a few stops from Southfields and a short walk to the venue. Plenty of shops and eateries near to hotel. Hotel was immaculately clean and the room possessed all the basic facilities required, Fridge, tea, coffee, small storage area, TV, toiletries, good shower, comfy bed. Towels were clean but had seen better days. Staff were pleasant and polite.

Review Title: Value for money though room a bit small
Negative Reviews: Room a bit small
Positive Reviews: Close to tube station

Negative Reviews: Bathroom was very small
Positive Reviews: location, just around the corner from the Tube

Negative Reviews: Expensive
Positive Reviews: Location

Review Title: Decent hotel near Earl’s Court road
Negative Reviews: The Bed was very had
Positive Reviews: Good location, staff was helpful. Very clean room

Negative Reviews: Room size. For the price would've expected more.
Positive Reviews: Location is very good. Just around a well connected tube stop. Rooms are recently refurbished and so quite modern and decent.

Review Title: Clean, nice, new and good value for money.
Negative Reviews: All rooms are very small, but it is London
Positive Reviews: My third time in one year. New clean rooms, very good houekeeping service. Convenient lcocation just next to Tube station.
Great Location - helpful and friendly staff - excellent room quality.

Review Title: Great location, good breakfast does the job as a place to rest your head for a night
Negative Reviews: The view from the room was quite bleak, the room was small, the bathroom was really small a little claustrophobic in all honesty. Reception staff were quite dismissive I thought, talking across to each other not friendly or welcoming so you don’t get the best first impression. There were always holes in the walls so the room looked a little run down.
Positive Reviews: The location was fab, the breakfast was really good as well.

Review Title: Good location for exploring the city
Negative Reviews: The staff that attended us needs training. Other old staff also has an attitude. There is no harm greeting with a smile rather than a stare and ignoring.
Positive Reviews: We chose the biggest size room. Room is clean and tidy. Airconditioning is also good. Cleaning in the room is everyday. Easy way to roam the city because Earls court station is just 20 meters away.

Review Title: Lovely hotel in a great location. Small rooms.
Negative Reviews: Rooms and bathroom very small. Difficult to store luggage.
Positive Reviews: Location. Renovated bathrooms.

Negative Reviews:
The rooms are very small. I had requested two twin beds as this trip was for me and my sister, but even with the beds "separated" we were still sleeping shoulder-to-shoulder. The rooms are stylish and the bed is comfortable, but be prepared that the rooms, hallways, and overall facilities are quite small. 

Other than Marcelo (who was fantastic!), the rest of the staff was curt, unpleasant, and unhelpful. We joked that they had made it a competition to see who could answer questions using the fewest words.
Positive Reviews:
The facilities were very new--in fact, I think some rooms were still under construction or had just been renovated. Nice high-end finishes and stylish touches. 

The highlight of our stay was Marcelo, who went out of his way to show kindness and made every effort to ensure our stay was comfortable. The hotel would do well to hire more staff members like him!

Location was unbeatable! Right around the corner from Earls Court station, which made it easy to get around London. Lots of nice restaurants, pubs, and cafes within easy walking distance--we could have spent a day just wandering the area near the hotel.

Review Title: Excellent stay, would happily recommend it.
Negative Reviews: Nothing!
Positive Reviews:
Good location, just round the corner from Earls Court station.
Very comfortable bed.
I loved having a fridge in the room.
The room had everything we needed. Great job!

Negative Reviews:
A few things could be improved. The dining room has a lot of lighting fixtures which are set too low and my husband hit his head on the first day when getting up from the table. We saw a few people banging their head when coming into the dining room. We reported this to the reception and I really hope that this will be fixed! 

The breakfast is OK but not great. The bread selection is very plain, mostly sliced bread. I would have liked more interesting and healthy bread. There is only salted butter which is weird for breakfast, doesn’t go with jam.  The fruit selection was poor. Still, it is a very good spread.
Positive Reviews: I was a little apprehensive about the hotel because not all the reviews were positive but I was very happy about the hotel altogether. The staff at the reception were very friendly. The hotel was totally renovated during the Covid pandemic and everything was done in good taste with very modern facilities. We booked a Deluxe room. True the room is small and if you got 2 large suitcases you have a problem. We had 2 trolleys so we were ok. The bed was very comfy. I liked the control panel near the bed controlling the lighting and the A/C. Everything worked perfectly. The bathroom was well equipped and also modern. Everything was very clean. The location is really very convenient so close to Earl’s Court underground, and a few stations away from theaters, museums and shopping.  The street is very nice and quiet.

Review Title: great central london hotel for the money
Negative Reviews: Breakfast wasn't the best but ok.
Positive Reviews: Great staff and location.

Negative Reviews: The room wasn’t cleaned twice, the staff not too helpful
Positive Reviews: Location, fair room

Negative Reviews: they gave an underground room for my daughters, and this condition wasn’t mentioned in the booking.
Positive Reviews: good location,2 minutes to tube ,everything nearby,

Negative Reviews: Nothing to complain except the room was tiny but served it’s purpose.
Positive Reviews: The property was clean and perfectly located to the Piccadilly line, Earls Court station. There were also tons of food options in walking distance and on a nice quiet street.

Negative Reviews: Being right by a main road can make it a little noisy at times, but that's a small thing and you don't hear the traffic from the hotel.
Positive Reviews: The Merit Kensington is well located in a hub of shops and tourist attractions with a underground station at its centre. This made it very convenient to travel and get around.

Negative Reviews: Room was very small, about the size seen in hotels in Japan. However, it was well designed, and housekeeping was impeccable.
Positive Reviews: Quiet and very well-renovated hotel just around the corner from Earls Court tube station on the District line. We had a 4th floor room above a quiet residential street. It had a good elevator, strong AC, good lighting and thick towels. Good-sized shower in a small bathroom. Very convenient for sight-seeing. Good commercial area just around corner with an excellent small grocery, fast food, pharmacy, and restaurants. I'd stay again.

Negative Reviews: you have not a lot of room for your stuff, room wasn't ready before 3pm even though it was confirmed that it should be ready by 2.
Positive Reviews: you have everything near the hotel, the room is very good

Negative Reviews: The room was a bit small but was enough for me as a solo traveller.
Positive Reviews: It is very clean, new and staff is helpful. The location is literally 2 min from underground and many places are easily accessible with public transport.

Review Title: Very clean and quiet hotel in great location
Negative Reviews: There was nothing we didn't like! If I was being REALLY picky, the quality of the shampoo/conditioner could be better and there was no view from the window (but we didn't mind this because our room was very quiet) other than that it was great.
Positive Reviews: Rooms exceptionally clean, large and comfortable beds, quality linens, plentiful supply of toiletries. Very quiet rooms and within steps of Earls Court tube.

Negative Reviews: Weird smell in the lobby and  I didnt like the horrible view outside my room
Positive Reviews:
I liked that it was close to the tube station
The room was pretty big for London and the bed was really comfortable

Negative Reviews: Small room size
Positive Reviews: Decor

Review Title: Good location but too expensive for what it is.
Negative Reviews:
The value for money you get doesn’t match for me personally. The beds are very uncomfortable, the pillows are the worst I had in a while, very thin and no support at all. Be prepared for neck pain the next morning.
The staff were polite but not what I would be used to when charged nearly €300 per night.
Positive Reviews: The location is great, also the building itself looks lovely

Negative Reviews: no space to put personal items on counter. tiny closet shelving. Breakfast mgr. didn't offer eggs to be cooked. But did offer to other diners. I had to ask each time.
Positive Reviews: Location!!! Near Tube

Review Title: Merit hotel complimented my visit to London. Excellent.
Negative Reviews:
Absolutely nothing.
I preferred to include it under what I like as I am seeking advice.
Positive Reviews:
Excellent property, clean, super breakfast and wonderful staff.   What did you do wrong? NOTHING, will I come back YES.   
One small item you could help me with, I upgraded for a bigger room (using the button upgrade). What transpired was that I got a room with three beds,  so, I finally got perhaps less space as there were three beds and two of us. 
If you could tell me what to book for next time, and whether I could book directly with you?

Review Title: It was comfortable. Modern, slick, clean.
Negative Reviews: See above.
Positive Reviews: This is the case in all of Great Britain, Scotland and England, but we hate the one thick cover, instead of the option of using just a sheet, as in the case in the USA. This, along with less than USA standards for AC, can make for an uncomfortable situation. Why do you do this?

Negative Reviews: Our room was a bit too small to our liking. The space to walk from the bed into the bathrooms is not possible without basically sliding  over the edge of the bed and we're definitely not large people but would still say it's fine for a weekend getaway. Do not bring more than one large luggage for this room size cause you won't have much space to open them. A USB charger outlet next to the bed lamps would be nice to have especially for non-UK visitors just as a point for constructive criticism.
Positive Reviews: Late check-in was available and staff very friendly even at 1am. The hotel is very clean and well kept. The furniture looked fairly new. We were never bothered by room cleaning when the Do Not Disturb sign was active. The location is great if traveling by train/subway the District/Picadelly lines get you basically everywhere in the city. There's a decent sized fridge to store a large bottle water and snacks and there's a small convenience store just a few meters away walking towards the subway. The hotel is definitely great for a weekend getaway.

Negative Reviews: We were on the basement level and at the front. Our window opened up into the area all the staff worked first thing in the morning with respect for cleaning and laundry. It was noisy and we couldn't open our blinds. That said we were up and out early everyday so it was not necessarily a huge problem for us but it would have been nice to open the blinds/curtains
Positive Reviews: We had stayed there when it was the Oxford. The renovations have been remarkable.

Negative Reviews: the breakfast was decent. the cooked breakfast could have been better but they were plenty of pastries to chose from.
Positive Reviews: very clean, aesthetically pleasing and nice place to be. staff were very friendly! the room itself was beautiful, we even got upgraded 2 rooms higher than the one we booked which made the experience more enjoyable. the room was very modern and the bathroom was lovely.

Review Title: Budget single room was tiny and expensive, location is amazing and bed comfortable
Negative Reviews: I stayed in a budget single room and omg it was tiny. You couldn’t have a suitcase open and open the door. Anything more than 1 night would have been claustrophobic. It was also insanely expensive - about £220 for one night.
Positive Reviews: Location is excellent, 2 min walk from earls court tube stop, and lots of restaurants in a walkable distance. The bed was comfy and facilities high tech and modern.

Location, room , cleanliness, shower and access location to Piccadilly line! Great for airport!

Entrance needs work for ease of customers with luggage or any mobility issues or limitations.

Negative Reviews: The toilet was right next to the bed, which was quite uncomfortable, especially because you can hear and smell everything from the bathroom, because the door was out of glass and there were 20cm between door and wall.
Positive Reviews: Personal was very friendly, it was really clean and modern. The area is really good.
The room was clean and well-designed, even the small ones. I stayed in two types of rooms due to separate bookings over a few days. Staff is great and the location very convenient.

Negative Reviews: no elevator, compact rooms

Negative Reviews: I asked the hotel to book a taxi in advance for the airport and they did. they told me the price, I asked if I could pay by card directly to the driver but it turned out that the taxi driver did not have the card machine and wanted me to pay cash. I had to catch my flight and I had to go to a ATM to Pat him and this was very annoying. I think the hotel should be more careful when booking a taxi for their clients and to be clear with the taxi company all in advance.

P.S. at the check-in process, they block your credit card as 100 GBP for the deposit and it is returned after the check-out.

Review Title: We really enjoyed the stay in this cosy hotel with the nice and helpful staff.
Negative Reviews:
For sustainability, the hotel could pay attention if new towels are needed (put on the floor) or if the guest wants to use them twice or more. 
For breakfast, we missed some dark bread or some buns. Only the first two days there have been buns, otherwise only croissants and toast and a lot of sweets like pain au chocolat and other sweet scones.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is situated near the station of the tube "picadilly line". So it was great to travel fast to Picadilly Circus. The room was superior, which means, was a bit larger than other rooms at this place. We liked it very much. The bed was comfortable, the cushions I would prefer another quality but we really understand the connectedness between material and hygienic standards. The room was tidied up daily and we really appreciated it.  We also appreciated the hot drinks like Cappuccino and chocolate in the room. Thank you! We would stay next time as well in your hotel. Thank you!

well located, friendly staff

Review Title: One of the best stays I've had in the London area to date. Would definitely stay here again.
Negative Reviews: My only two minor complaints were that there could be an explanation of how to lock the windows in the room (we don't have that type of lock mechanism where the handle rotates up to lock in our country) , & another power point for charging handphones & other electronic devices at the same time would be nice.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the Earls Court train station, along with a supermarket, bakery, & a number of restaurants to suit most tastes. Check-in & check-out were fast and easy, with the staff being very friendly & helpful. The rooms were very clean, with all necessities provided.

Review Title: Lovely clean modern hotel in good location

Poor customer service, may have been the night staff at the end of a long night but didn’t reflect the service of the staff the night before or the standards this hotel appears to portray.
Positive Reviews: Location good. Had to find somewhere to stay last minute as had family in Chelsea and Westminster hospital. Check in staff friendly and helpful. Room clean, quiet, modern and bathroom nice with good shower. Would definitely stay again.

Review Title: Good location. Extremely clean and had a great night sleep in a spacious comfy bed. Would stay again (in the garden faci
Negative Reviews:
We had a garden facing room with a balcony but unfortunately there’s no way to access the balcony and no opportunity to open a window. 
Breakfast was disappointing (for the price).  Very limited options and some staff whilst smiley and seemingly friendly could not understand or speak English and everything had to be referred to one person who appeared to be in charge.
Positive Reviews:
Very clean, extremely comfortable bed and lovely and quiet which ensured a great nights sleep. 
We required housekeeping (to remove a baby’s cot in the room), to provide an ironing board and iron and to adjust the aircon temperature (controlled externally from the room). They couldn’t have been quicker, friendlier or more efficient. Thank you!

Negative Reviews: The only problem we had was that the air-conditioning was too cold - our room was uncomfortably chilly, as was also the Breakfast Room. There was a temperature control box in the room but that said the room temp was 30°C, so was obviously not working!
Positive Reviews: The location is excellent - just 2 mins' walk from Earls Court tube station, yet set in a quiet side street.  The rooms were apparently renovated during the coronavirus pandemic and  our two rooms - a double and a twin on thre 1st floor - were beautifully and elegantly decorated and equipped. Rooms and bathrooms are small, but that is to be expected in converted houses like this.  Everything absolutely spotless and great attention to detail - such as the sliding shower door automatically closing all the way so that the floor doesn't get wet. The Breakfast Room is one of the nicest we have stayed in for years! And a good choice of breakfast items. The staff were all really friendly and helpful.

Hotel explained they do not get paid for the room until the guests check in/out which is why they needed to charge us an extra holding fee. Anyway it all worked out fine as the holding charge that was pending on the card was cancelled following checkout. Did not spoil our stay and we would definitely stay there again and recommend this very comfortable hotel for overnight London stays to friends.

Review Title: I would recommend this hotel as it boasts cheap prices but with a luxurious touch.
Negative Reviews: n/a
Positive Reviews:
Firstly, the layout of this hotel was odd, whereby the reception was separated from the rooms. The hotel and rooms can be found on the same street and are only separated by a few doors up or down from the reception. When entering the reception area, the first thing to notice was the area was very small and could be very crowded especially if multiple people are either booking in or booking out. 

The staff members were quiet and although not rude nor unprofessional, they did appear disinterested. Please also be aware this hotel asks for an further £100 to cover any issues and this amount will be refunded back to you after your stay. 

Myself and my partner had the deluxe double room booked for one night. The room itself was very clean and tidy. The room boasted tea, coffee and water for no extra charge. The bathroom was clean and modern with shower gel and shampoo to use freely. The room also consisted of other items such as a TV, blow dryer, mini fridge, safe, air conditioning etc. The lights for the room were controlled with an electrical pad which could be located in various places in the room such as next to the bed and the door. This was extremely handy, yet so simple! 

The hotel is located roughly 3 minutes away from the closest tube station and provides easy access to the central part of London. 

Overall, I would recommend this hotel as it boasts cheap prices but with a luxurious touch.
Staff, location, room, breakfast

Bed was large and comfortable. Lovely modern bathroom (albeit small but you're in central London so of course it's small xD) with a rain shower. You control the lights and put on a do not disturb with buttons on the wall, including multiple lighting levels so you don't wake up to a super bright light! It's a small thing but I thought it was a nice touch. For the price for 3 nights my stay was fantastic. A few min walk to earls court station and West Brompton.

The space was immaculate and Housekeeping came in every day. There was separate settings for Air Con and Under floor heating in the bathroom, so warm where it needed to be. All lights and Do not disturb signs etc were controlled from an electronic panel too. Best of all was the Breakfast room, nice design with lovely fresh food. The hot option was Eggs - Omelette, Fried or Scrambled (made to order) otherwise a nice choice of continental. Casual breakfast staff but good discreet service.

Positive Reviews: This was our first time staying at the Merit Kensington. It has easy access to the airport on the Piccadilly line and it is right around the corner from the tube stop (just a very short walk). It is easy to get to the main tourist areas from here as well. The rooms look new and are very clean. They were tidied each day (not necessary for us, but nice). The bed was comfortable. We did not have breakfast as there are many cafes nearby. The rooms are small, we had a quad room, but nicely organized. There was a wall dividing the beds which was nice. There is plenty of plugs and charging spots in the rooms beside the beds. Our room faced the back and was quiet but the street out front did not seem too busy either. We will stay here again.

booking in clerk made me feel defensive and in the wrong.  I had paid for a more expensive room in order to have twin beds.  I emailed the property to ask for twin beds and they confirmed they would allocate a twin.  luckily I checked in very early as the girl booking me in said it was not noted on their file and didn’t seem to believe that I was entitled to a twin room.  her more senior colleague intervened and said this would be possible and she had a helpful attitude.

the one lift was out of action and I had to use the stairs to the third floor carrying my bag.  ( I am 75).   the stair carpet to the first floor had come loose and I slipped and almost fell.   I reported this.

luggage storage was in reception, not in a locked room although they say there is luggage storage facility.

The one shelf in the bathroom was already filled with complimentary items (which were nice), but left no room for our own toiletries. The mattress was a bit too hard for our liking. The rooms were equipped with a well working AC unit, but the placement of the unit was not well thought out. When enabled, it would blow icy cold air right in your face while you were in bed. Not great for one of our party, who is susceptible to ear infections. When disabled, the room would immediately start to become uncomfortably warm due to its small size. The window could be opened, but that helped little, and the window would fall shut on its own after a while as well. So we basically had a choice of either letting the AC make us sick, or sweating it out during the night.
Positive Reviews: The hotel was immaculately clean and the staff was very helpful. Breakfast, while pretty basic, was fresh and tasty.

Review Title: A great place to stay for this solo traveller!
Negative Reviews: I would have rated the property a 10/10, had it not been for the fact that no toilet paper was included in my daily room service on three separate occasions during my stay. On the one occasion that I rang down for some one morning, it never arrived by the time I left for the day (so I ended up collecting it from reception myself upon my return that evening). That said, every other aspect of the daily cleaning was superb, though. One other thing to keep in mind that might be a problem for some people - the noise from the street was quite noticeable, as was the noise from the hallways with other guests and cleaning staff along with the noise from others in the rooms/floors above using showers, basins and toilets at all times of the day/night.
Positive Reviews: I found the room to be excellent for me as a solo traveller. In fact, I felt the space was more than ample (and it felt bigger than what I expected based on photos and the blurb of the property online). This was great, as I stayed for a fortnight! The bed was super comfortable, the ability to control the brightness of the lights and the room temperature was fantastic, and the option of using a hand-held shower head or overhead rain shower was a nice touch. The room I was allocated was very modern, indicating that perhaps an update may have occurred in the recent past. The location could not have been better in terms of accessibility to Earl's Court tube station and local buses, and my room was accessible by lift within the building (which was great!). I would not hesitate to stay here again myself, nor would I be concerned about recommending Merit Kensington to others.

Our specific room had a couple of drawbacks:
1. Very minimal natural light, the window opened to what felt like we were in a basement. Bedroom lights were required to be on throughout the day, if you're out all day and stopping here to sleep then it is a non issue.
2. Our room was right next to a lift and very audible as well, this happened throughout the night and I think specific to our room. People traffic noise was frequent and would take place throughout the night which did disturb my sleep.
3. Rooms were pretty small for the price, but the trade off was a great location, not necessarily a downside but worth noting.

Negative Reviews:
While the rooms exterior was modernized and seemed to be recently renovated, the building was a bit old - I could hear the pipes, and unfortunately there was a smell from them as well (not too much, but I needed to open windows to let it go). The walls were not exactly withstanding the noise from the nearby room, but I believe this is due to the noise there exceeding usual levels (someone turned on TV to its max volume I think).
But this was def minor, hence I can't really say this will prevent me from booking in the hotel my next stay in London!
Positive Reviews:
The room was just refurbished, and looked great! I totally expected it to be a 'cupboard' type of stay, just to spend the night, but the room was designed very well and had a lot of space considering its size. The location was superb - I could travel to every touristic part of the city without any problem and rarely used connections.
The room was clean, toiletries were good and quite a nice amount of them available for the use. Taking the price into account, I had also a small fridge and tea/coffee with a kettle, which was totally unexpected!

Staff was very friendly: I also was able to set a delivery to the reception for a few parcels, and it arrived very quickly and was hold till my visit with no problem. One day when the neighbor was rather loud, the receptionist tried to help to the best of her abilities - really appreciate the effort too.
Definitely great value for the price which exceeded my expectations!

Review Title: Blood marvelous! (will definitely come back again&again!)
Negative Reviews: One thing I could fault though is the air conditioning. We went there during sunny days (17-18 degrees) & it was really warm. We had to ring reception to turn on the air condition (which is absolutely fine by the way) but I think it was timed. It turned off after a couple of hours & during the night, we woke up because the room was so hot.
Positive Reviews:
There are a multiple of reasons why I love Merit Kensington:

1. 3 minutes away from Earl's Court Station - which means very accessible & near to all things London. Shops & good restaurants are just within the vicinity as well. 

2. Free room upgrade! - since I am on the Genius level they have upgraded my room for free which is a definite bonus.

3. Clean, new, & high tech rooms - they made sure that the room is tidy & clean. When we first came, the room smell like it is brand new. No traces of odor or stains seen all throughout. 

4. Comfortable bed & clean toilet/bathroom - as a regular traveler, what I always look for in a hotel/place is the bed and bathroom and both have 5-star rating in this hotel. The bed is super comfortable (I am a light sleeper, but man, did I sleep like a log!) & the bathroom is one of my favourites during this stay. 

5. Very helpful & polite staff - being situated in London, it is very rate to be greeted with friendly staff. The hotel staff are beyond helpful & so courteous.

Review Title: Nice hotel for a stay in a great area of london
Negative Reviews: No bads ill be back ;)
Positive Reviews:
Very nice hotel for a great relationship price offer in a very nice area of kensington next to earls court underground.
The room was very comfortable and the bathroom/shower  very nice . Soundproof so very quiet also ...choose rooms from 3rd floor

Review Title: Overall it was pleasant but not luxurious, ideal for business trips but not necessarily leisure!
Negative Reviews:
Due to some misunderstanding, my partner and I had been upgraded to the superior room out of courtesy for the hotels mistake. The room was made to look very special with rose petals on the bed a swan towels, very cute touch. 
However, the room size was very poor for a ‘superior room’, particularly the bathroom. The bathroom barely had enough room to move comfortably around in and I am of a small build and height.
The bed was very comfortable but it was two single beds pushed together which we were not impressed with. 
When we came back from our theatre night, we really wanted to get comfortable so we asked if the hotel could provide us with any robes or slippers of which they did not. We were told that hotel did not provide these amenities which we thought was rather disappointing given the cost of the stay. 
The hotel rooms were in VERY close capacity to eachother and things could be heard through the walls which isn’t really what you want during a peaceful trip away. 
It would appear that the hotel wanted to fit as many guests in as possible rather than making the hotel a better quality by designing bigger rooms.
Positive Reviews:
The hotel is in a brilliant location, literally a minute walk to Earls Court station which runs the Piccadilly and Northen Line. Very convenient for travelling around London.
The reception area was very warm and inviting and had tasteful decor as did the rooms.
The majority of the staff were friendly and pleasant, one gentleman in particular who couldn’t have been more thorough and outgoing to assist us. We did not get his name however he was a young chap with fair hair, a foreign accent and he wore glasses. Very lovely young man!

Review Title: A great find, will definitely be back.

Review Title: Excellent newish hotel with a few random things that need attention to make it even more perfect
Negative Reviews:
There are a few odd things that need attention.

For a 4 star hotel I would expect having water in the room. 
You can not adjust the temperature in the room. It is done via reception. It was freezing cold when I checked in and it took a while to heat up (after me calling to ask to put on the heating). You then have to call again for them to turn down the heating once the room is heated up.
No slippers- luckily I took my own. 
The bathroom is quite tight. I am a slim person, so it wasn't a big deal (you have to dry yourself in the room).
The third floor hallway has an incredible toxic air freshener smell- its too much. 

Once these things are sorted and I stay again, I will rate them 10!

Our room was large and warm and had a lovely bathroom with underfloor heating. Spotlessly clean. There is a fridge and safe. The curtains gave good blackout and the room was very quiet, minimal noise from other rooms and none from outside. We were also visited by next door's cat - Felix!

Superbly clean and comfortable.

Review Title: Lovely stay, impeccably clean, excellent location
Negative Reviews: Our room (315) was at the top of the stairs straight into the reception area, which didn't have any doors and you can therefore hear all conversations at all hours. The corridor light was shining under the room door all night, and the light panel at the bedside remained lit all night, so if you're a light sleeper you may need an eye mask.
Positive Reviews:
The room was impeccably clean -  even the shower cubicle was free from mould and grime, which I seem to find as the norm in most hotels these days!
There was a snazzy light panel at both sides of the bed to control the room lights, choose a "do not disturb" or "clean" for the room. 
A fridge in the room is a nice touch in a hotel that doesn't do food or drink so you can have your own.
The location was excellent, less than 5 minutes walk from Earl's Court tube station, and walking distance to the museums and Kensington High Street.
Great value for money. 3 minute walk to the underground. Friendly staff. Would stay here again.

Review Title: A small, clean Hotel in the center of London for a reasonable price. We will come again!
Negative Reviews: The room was smaller than we thought, especially the bathroom, where they somehow manadged to squeeze in a shower, sink and Toilette. Sitting on the Toilette while your head touches the wall is not very comfortable, but something you can live with. But dont bring big luggage with you. Next time we just take a bigger room. Unfortunately our air conditioner was broken on the last days of stay and the shower was leaking. Luckily they cleaned it every day.
Positive Reviews: We loved the location close to the Tube. It was very clean, in fact they cleaned the room every day during 7 days of stay. And the room was well furnitured, they used the small space very well. The stuff was very friendly and kindly let us check in 1h earlier. Although we were next to the elavotar in the 4 floor it was not noisy. We felt all in all very safe because of the cameras in the Hotel.

Negative Reviews: The curtains in the room didn't close quite properly which was a shamed but didn't at all spoil my enjoyment of the room.  It might be annoying in the summer though when it gets light earlier

Review Title: Lovely stay in a cosy, modern room. Friendly staff and great location.

I loved the light settings in the room, very ambient and cosy. The shower was a decent size and it was great also to have a fridge in the room and a full length mirror. The hotel felt safe and secure. Although my room was listed as a 'single room' the bed is almost as big as a double.
The location is excellent for Kensington region and is easily accessible from Earls Court tube station.

Review Title: Great stay! Nice staff and lovely room with balcony.
Negative Reviews: Only thing that would’ve made it better is breakfast.

Negative Reviews: The only thing I can think of is that a bottle of water in the room would have been nice, but that's a very small thing. There are plenty of shops nearby where you can get your own. Apart from that, everything was very good.
Positive Reviews:
This place was excellent! Would absolutely stay again and recommend to anyone. 

I was staying there with two friends and we got the quadruple room. The decor was very nice and modern (just like in the photos) and the touch screen panels by the bed were really great - you could control the air con and set various lighting levels easily. The curtains were surprisingly efficient at keeping out the morning sun. Fridge is a nice addition and we were provided with four tumblers and four wine glasses. The room is a perfectly good size for three average-sized girls, but might be a little tight if you were a larger person. 

The location is a real plus - just a minute or two from Earl's Court tube station which services the Picadilly line, Central line and District line. What's great about this is that you can take the tube from Heathrow right to Earl's Court. It's just a really handy tube station to be near. We got the tube every day.

The front desk staff were very friendly and allowed us to leave bags in the luggage room all day.

I wouldn't say this place is the absolute lap of luxury but it's excellent value for what it is in my opinion. I think the pictures accurately reflected our room. I will definitely be back though. Very positive experience.

Negative Reviews: The bed was a bit uncomfortable for me, the pillows felt hard and lumpy. The mattress felt a bit thin. The rainfall shower head needed cleaning a bit more, there was limescale blocking the flow of water. Bottles water in the room would have been nice. I would definitely stay again.
Positive Reviews: The location is perfect, next to Earl’s Court station. Check in was easy. The room, although small was well equipped. Smart tv, high tech, underfloor heating in the bathroom. For the price you really can’t complain, I was surprised by just how much I got. The different lighting settings were very clever, the air con was probably one of the best I’ve experienced in London. Quiet and very effective. The public areas were tastefully decorated too

Positive Reviews: Comfortable bed, clean room.

Negative Reviews:
I had a negative experience at the hotel. The young guy at the reception rushed my check-in, and the room only had enough towels for one person instead of two. Despite calling the reception for more towels, they were not delivered. The only helpful staff member was a guy from the night shift.

Furthermore, I left my Marshall speaker in the room, and when I contacted the hotel, they initially denied that I had left anything behind. After insisting and asking for an investigation, they suddenly found the speaker. I arranged for a friend to pick it up, and when she went to get it, the same young guy at the reception insisted that nothing was left there, and there was no record of the speaker. Eventually, someone else from the staff (a lady) found the speaker but did not apologize for the inconvenience.

These incidents have made me reconsider staying at this hotel in the future.

Negative Reviews: My other concern is we paid the pre authorisation fee of £100 upon arrival on my bank card. but when I checked my bank acc. I had two pre authorisations for £100 pending @ Merit Kensington. one for 25/11/23 and the other 24hrs later on the 26/11/23. I contacted the hotel directly and explained my concerns, they didn't seem to understand my concern and didn't seem bothered. even when I explained the two separate times the pre authorisation happened. 16.23pm on the arrival day and 16.18pm on the following day. it has taken til Wednesday to have one of the pending £100 on my account removed still leaving £100 pending to Merit Kensington which then disappeared on Thursday. I wonder if this happens to everyone who stays there? I have found it very stressful and it has spoilt our weekend away! so we will definately look to stay elsewhere.

Review Title: On the whole, it was a good night stay
Negative Reviews:
Please, listen to my suggestions so than I will be more happy on my next stay. 
The main business telephone numbers provided both in the guest information book and on the website is always off or no one answer it.  You inform your guest in your guest book about numbers need to bee dialled from the bedroom if the guest required assistant. Also, your hotel employee  informed me about this as well. However, you have forgotten to install the landline phone in the bedroom while your main phone line is off except when is not when you don't answer it as I previously mentioned. Because I tried to call you from my mobile phone many times.  If it would be an emergency, you would fail to provide a safe place to stay. 
Its seems you must have done a great refurbishment but you need to finish it. 
The single bedroom is more likely a box room where no room to put down my luggage and open it. 
The shower cubicle with toilet is fairly okay but the mini wash basin is useless because its unsuitable for purpose.  Almost looks like a decoration not an actual bathroom wash basin. 
Could you please ask your cleaners to dust behind the TV screen because its seems hasn't been cleaned for a year. 
The heating system is not actually working properly. I think something wrong between the AC and Heater. I had to turn it off because my sinus is very sensitive and I didn't want to sleep wearing a hat in bed all night. I think sleeping cap is out of fashion this days. :-) 
Thanks for your understanding

Thoroughly enjoyed my recent stay at the Merit Hotel. 

I came for a one night break for my mother’s birthday and arrival was upgraded to a family room which offered 3 beds ( two single and one double) instead of the twin i originally booked which was a nice touch. 

Room is compact but has everything required for a one night stay and laid out well. Area with Hangers, small Safe and empty mini Fridge was also handy to have to chill drinks. The outside and inside communal areas are clean and tidy and very modern like the rooms.  

The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the Earls Court Underground Station.

Would definitely visit again!

Review Title: Great for a short city stay
Negative Reviews:
The area is kind of mixed. Not super nice but very convenient lots of attractions and places to go, very central. 
I booked a deluxe double room and it said on Booking.com that this was larger than average but it was in fact quite tiny. 
It was very compact with a small shower/toilet. The bed was a double fairly small for larger people. To be honest I can't remember how this was specified on the Web I should have been more attentive. It cost not much more than a basic but seriously, I am confused now as to how a basic could possibly be any different from a deluxe then.
Very new, very modern and super clean for a short city stay. The bathroom floor was gently heated even on summer days the warm tiles were lovely. 
The reception is two doors down from the Merit which was a bit unusual, there was no reception, no lobby seating, no Cafe or anything, or any visible staff at all in the hotel itself apart from the cleaners in the morning. 
There was a bit of noise from next door not sure if this was a fault in isolation or they were just super loud lots of thumping as if they were moving the furniture. Very strange!

Negative Reviews:
On Friday, 23rd August, we arrived at the hotel at 20:30 with two large suitcases. We were greeted by Nolix, and initially, everything seemed fine. We paid the £100 deposit, and he assigned us a room in the other building. Upon arriving at the other building, we discovered that the lift was not working. It's infuriating to know that Nolix was fully aware of this yet still chose to assign us a room on the third floor, Room 121. This is unacceptable.

We returned to the reception and questioned Nolix about the lift, as when you pay for a hotel stay, you expect all facilities to be functional and available. We are entitled to use all the amenities we paid for. He assured us that the lift company would come to inspect the lift, and we'd be informed of the outcome. He then offered us a smaller room as an alternative, which was entirely unsatisfactory. We paid for a specific room, and we should have been offered something of equal value of room 121, not something inferior even if it was an upgrade.

Adding insult to injury, when we asked Nolix if he could assist us with our luggage, given that we are two young women struggling with heavy bags, he outright refused. This lack of basic courtesy and assistance was appalling. We were left with no choice but to carry the heavy luggage ourselves. To our dismay, an elderly guest, probably in his 60s, offered to help us, but we couldn't in good conscience accept his help. I have documented medical issues with back pain, yet we had to haul the luggage ourselves up three flights of stairs.

On 24th August, we contacted reception again about the lift and were shocked to receive a completely different explanation. We had been led to believe that the lift would be fixed soon, so this inconsistency left us both disappointed and extremely dissatisfied. We were told to wait for the outcome, but it was clear at this point that we were being strung along.

On 25th August, we inquired once more about the lift.
Positive Reviews: Location.

Review Title: Merit Kensington was my cozy, comfortable home base while visiting London's amazing attractions.
Negative Reviews: I have zero complaints. One suggestion would be a luggage table or rack in the room like I've seen in other hotels.
Positive Reviews: Excellent spread of food for breakfast in a beautifully kept dining area. Friendly courteous staff throughout. Rooms modern, clean, comfortable, spacious, quiet. Daily room cleaning & refreshing was excellent. Email inquiries I made pre-arrival were answered in a timely manner. Most handy was luggage storage service post-checkout allowing me to leave bags with them while I spent my last hours touring London. Earl's Court is convenient to everything with Tube station just around the corner. Earl's Court area is busy with people. There are so many stores, shops, restaurants there to fulfill every need and appetite. Yet the hotel is on a quiet street around the corner away from the Earl's Court hub-bub. I felt safe and secure everywhere about the neighborhood. I will definitely stay again!

I knew the kettle was working fine so I challenged this. I was told I'd broken the lid. On challenging again, the £40 was eventually refunded. I cancelled my next booking as I really don't like this type of hassle. I've stayed at hundreds of hotels and never had this type of issue before.

The room was next to the lift. The lift noise didn't bother me so much as the guests who would chat by the lift at 1am or 3am in the morning. Unbelievable. Not the hotel's fault, but something I will make sure to avoid in future when I make a booking.

(Also, Booking.com should warn guests that a £100.00 deposit will be requested on arrival.  I understand some hotels do this, but it would be great to be told in advance).

Apart from this, I was very happy.
Positive Reviews: The room was immaculately clean and tidy. Nice bathroom with underfloor heating. A great shower. Had a very comfortable queen sized bed. The room also had a kettle and fridge which was fab. Would definitely recommend and be very happy to return to this hotel in the future. The location is excellent, very close to Earls Court tube. There's an M&S and Boots at the end of the street, which again was very handy.

Negative Reviews: Room was on the smaller side and could hear people walking about in corridors etc, but not enough to put you off.
Positive Reviews:
So professional, clean and had a high end finish. 
Location was second to none, right outside earls court station so transport links in and around London were great. Comfortable room, with everything you need and more. Value for money for what you get in London was great. Will 100% return.

Negative Reviews: The reception staff was a bit non-chalant towards us. We didn't even receive a "Welcome" or "thank you for staying with us" or even a explanation about the room or the breakfast. We also had to ask our deposit back otherwise i'm not sure it would've been voided.

Also the rooms were small but not as bad as other reviews say (we had the deluxe). The bathroom was clean and a very very nice shower. I really do hope the woman behind the desk who was watching was a manager and spoke to him after about how he dealt with us. Such a shame as the hotel as beautiful. Negative Reviews: Maintenance needs to update routines. At first glance the room looks clean and modern, however in my room there was the smell of urine all throughout my stay. I tried to ignore it, but it was difficult to live like that. Then there's the sloppy maintenance. The bathtub drained slowly and was even blocked on the first night of my stay. The metal latch that connects the beds was missing a piece and thus it stuck out at an angle, something we had to be aware of as we walked around the bed as it could have cut our ankles. The Mirror and down light in the bathroom were damaged and hanging loosely... So all the small stuff adds up, I was just happy that I was only there a couple days. I just wanted a clean, well maintained room. The basic cleaners do a good job, but the upkeep is the issue here. Also, what's the deal with the fake grass out back? It's not even installed properly with spots of concrete not even covered. The price, the location and the short length of my stay were the only reasons I didn't move! I will not stay here again, nor will I  recommend to my contacts.

Review Title: Amazing hotel / Abusive credit card charges
Negative Reviews:
My ratings are very different from my overall score, and here's why:

THE HOTEL CHARGED MY CARD TWICE, WITHOUT MY CONSENT, even if our stay was paid ahead of our arrival and an amount of 600 EUR (150/night) was blocked at check-in. The hotel blocked an additional 300+ EUR two nights before check-out, and another 300+ EUR the night before check-out, without letting us know about these charges either at check-in, during our stay, or at checkout. Meaning we had 1200+ EUR blocked on our card for over a month, even though we were promised that any charges should be released in matter of days. The additional 2x300+ Euros represented the parking, breakfast and bar charged to our room, WHICH WE ACTUALLY PAID AT CHECKOUT, instead of deducting it from the initial 600 Euros OR the additionally charged 300 Euros.

In all of our travels in over 40+ countries we never encountered such abusive approach when it comes handling credit card information! Moreover the whole experience made us feel like we were considered as thieves who would run off without paying!

I'm seriously considering reporting these actions to the consumer protection authorities, which I'm sure would not hesitate to do a review and issue a fine. Because what guarantees do we have now, that our card won't be charged again?!

Although it was one of the best hotels and stays, and we really did enjoy our time both at Merit Kensington AND in Hamburg, I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this hotel.

Review Title: good location ; but too expensive for everything wrong with it
Negative Reviews:
the lack of help from staff with the bags. When i first checked in they put me in a room with a broken window seal, lots of flies and that smelled moldy. i wokeup with a cold the next day (im asthmatic so it was a disaster). they did agree to change the room for me given i was staying for a week but ended up giving me a smaller room than what i paid for. barely space to walk around.
when i asked for help to move my stuff, it was refused. Also, the phone in my room wasnt working so when i would call reception they couldnt hear me , but then no body came back to actually check what i needed. 
on my last day there i wokeup in the morning and there was NO HOT WATER. i had to shower in freezing cold water as i had a plane to catch. 
They took all my reusable fabric bags - including two expensive ones i had brought with me from home. they claimed they were thrown out because they thought it was trash and never even apologised for it. i personally think they were stolen because on my last day there i saw one of the cleaners using a similar fabric reusable carry on from Harrods for her cleaning products. in a country discouraging plastic bag usage i dont understand how they think fabric bags are trash.

The most upsetting incident to us is their rigid housekeeping rule. the housekeepers left us a note saying they are 4 star hotel so insisted to tidy up my bed when we were out, even though we have already clearly instructed them  beforehand not to tidy up the bed due to hygiene reason. we 1) told the receptionist but not happening, then 2) laid written notice on top of my bed and 3) pressed not-to-disturbed button.  Still, they did it 😤.  instead of explaining to me their reason of their insistent, they left a written note next to me note (2 above) claiming they need to clean my bed due to policy.  they must understand, if they were a high end hotel, instead of insisting of finishing their regular routine housekeeping tasks, satisfying customers’ want is more important.

Glad to say my fears were unwarranted. The room was tiny. That's true. One of the smaller I've ever stayed in, but it was comfortable, clean and well appointed. Reception staff was very polite, helpful and efficient. One of the rooms got a free upgrade, and by comparison, the Superior room is truly spacious, especially for London. Was it a 10? Maybe not (simply because of the size of the deluxe) but it's worth compensating for some of the - I'd argue - unjustified negative reviews I've seen. For a superior room it's very very close to a 10. Breakfast was not lavish, but we never left feeling hungry or unsatisfied. Location is absolutely perfect.

Me and my husband had a very pleasant stay at the Hotel. The room was spotless, the bed and pillows were very comfortable to sleep in. Overall, it was a very nice 1 night stay and its by far the best place we have ever booked.

Review Title: Good Staff but a disappointing hotel
Negative Reviews:
-Overpriced room (nearly £200 for a single night). 
-The room is really tiny and overcrowded. It’s ok for a solo guest but would be suffocating for a couple or a small family. The bathroom is stuffed as well. 
-The breakfast didn’t have variety even for a continental choice. 
-I got a room which looks over one of the rooftops of the floor below, so a horrible view and depressing. But I was staying for the night only so I passed it as the staff informed me it was the last room on the property. In my opinion they should shut that room and use it a storage room not a guest room. 
-TV had the 365 on-demand program but all shows were really old and not much variety.
-I would expect for the absurd amount I paid, to get help with my bag since it was heavy and the room was 2 buildings away from the reception, with stairs to go for the building until you reach the lift of the building, but as usual of this hotel it was disappointing to see that none of the staff cared to offer help with my bag.
-Won’t be staying again. Won’t recommend it for more than one night stay and only if you really have to.
Positive Reviews:
-Location just a few minutes from Earl’s Court underground station was very convenient. 
-The room and bathroom were clean. 
-Well prepared room with tea/coffee facilities, hair dryer and TV, USB and electricity sockets were multiple and well placed around the room for people with multiple devices needing charging.
-Staff were efficient and friendly. 
-The breakfast place looks elegant and nice but the food doesn’t match.

5. At request, we received the cancelation proof for the 100 pounds, amount withheld as a guarantee, at check in (as also stated on Booking.com)
6. Staff agreed to keep our luggage on the day of arrival and on the day of the departure.

Review Title: Do not book here! The location does not make up for the bad staff!
Negative Reviews:
We arrived and the guy at reception was hanging in his desk chair like a teenage boy in high school. The were obviously not prepared to welcome a guest (had to look for 5min in a folder for our booking) while it was already 4pm in the afternoon. 
They barely gave us any info or welcoming feeling. 
When entering the room it felt like we took a door straight to the north pole! The A/C was blasting at 18°C. 
Outside our window was a pile of trash bags. When I went up to ask to change rooms, to one without trash in front of the window a man shouted from the other side of the lobby (who I assume was the manager) "it is just linnen". 
No new room was given, the bags were moved but the next morning they were back. 
The A/C can't be controlled in the room (even-though there are 2 controllers in the room) but you have to call to reception to ask to change the setting for your room individually. That is if you can guess the receptions phone number, because that is nowhere to be found in the room. 
Just like the wifi password, which can only be found at reception.

We tried to leave the horrible first impression behind us, enjoyed the location and went to bed. At 8AM the next morning the cleaning crew woke us as they had gather outside our window for their morning briefing (this happened again the next morning) 

I have slept in hostels for 4EUR/night where the staff has been better trained than here! Do not book here, it will ruin your stay in London!

I traveled to Malaysia, Indonesia, Japan, Spain, France, Israel, China and Hongkong in the past 5 years and I use booking app every time. I have never encountered such deposit requirement in my journey. The receptionist says it’s a contract between the hotel and booking so I need to call booking.com to see if they can make a exception.  Turned out booking.com tells me to ask the property provider which is the hotel. Both of you were just avoiding responsibility and putting me who have lived in this Merit hotel for 17 days in 2020 in a confusing situation. After I finished the payment I heard the receptionist laughed. I stuck here for 2 hours and he thinks it’s funny. Clueless and unbelievable. Also the manager is no better.

Review Title: Great location, but disappointing service and a bit of a mickey mouse operation.
Negative Reviews: Check-in was not welcoming. The hotel is spread across a few terraced houses on the street - not consequentially, which isn't made clear at all. I arrived at 12 and lugged my luggage up the steps only to be told that reception is actually at 24, so I lug my luggage back down the stairs and down the road and up the stairs again. You're buzzed into a hallway with a desk set up beneath the stairs. A man with a short tone takes your ID details and then requests payment... I haven't even seen the room yet?! During check in there is a woman talking to the "receptionist" throughout in another language who clearly works there, but is not in uniform. It is quite mickey mouse in feeling and does not really give you much confidence to be honest. The room (101) is back at number 12 and on the lower ground level, its sold as a single so size is fine but it is right by the "emergency exit" to the street at the front of the house so the door - which is lacking a handle on the inside - is constantly slamming closed from guests and staff coming and going. If you are a light sleeper or have issues with noise, do not stay here. The street is quiet but the walls of the hotel are paper thin and it sounds like there is a washing machine that goes on spin cycle constantly, A/C? The bed was lumpy and despite housekeeping coming in and making it daily, it was poorly done with the duvet and pillows straightened but the sheets left loose and not pulled tight. They kept on bringing me new towels despite their supposed "green" policy which meant at one point I had 6 towels in my room. In general the housekeeping was poor and inconsistent. The bathroom door didn't close and there were no shelves to place your toiletries. The make-up mirror was broken and not usable without having to manually prop it up. There was nowhere to hang a full coat or dresses. On the final day I was woken up at 8.
Positive Reviews: Well you can't fault the location which is two minutes from Earl's Court station (district line) and there is a Prett, M&S Food and various other convenience stores on your doorstep. Its also a 15 min walk from the museum district which was super handy as that was what I was after. Also the shower was large and water pressure and heat great. I paid 419 GDP for 4 nights so... Z1 London prices that is quite cheap.

Review Title: Great location, clean room, but significant improvements needed to facilities!
Negative Reviews: The lift in building 12 wasn’t working and on speaking to some staff it would seem this has been the situation for a while. Thankfully we were on the first floor, but it was still difficult dragging a case up, and then down, the stairs. There was no offer of help with our cases. Then, once in the room, the air conditioning wasn’t working. This was a big problem as London was experiencing temperatures of 30+ degrees during our 3 day stay. We were advised the system was being reset and would then be fully working. That wasn’t the case! What followed was just a trickle of cold air but the room still averaged 25° at night which was uncomfortable. Reception staff simply advised us to open a window but noise from the main road made for a disturbing nights sleep! During our stay there were several other guests complaining about the lack of air conditioning. The safe in the room also didn’t work. The instructions provided didn’t correspond with the safe and when a member of staff came to look at this, we were advised it was a new safe and they didn’t know how it worked! Finally, we paid £16 per person for breakfast which we found to be very basic and not much choice.
Positive Reviews: The location of the hotel is in close proximity to Earls Court underground station which made getting around very easy. It was also in walking distance to several attractions e.g. Kensington Gardens, the V&A museum and Natural History Museum.

Negative Reviews:
Staff in this hotel does not know the meaning of the word "service."
I had a really terrible experience. 
I stayed there for 5 nights for work. The cost was well above 200 pounds per night. I have received a room on the last floor. No one mentioned during the check-in that the elevator was broken, and since my room was not in the same building, I discovered that fact only when I came there, already after taking stairs twice from the building of the reception and the my own one. 
I asked several times when the elevator gonna be fixed and every time received an answer " tomorrow." When I left, the elevator still did not work. Before check out, I called reception and asked Damian to help me take my luggage down. After climbing to the fourth floor for 5 days, I had terrible back pain and still  got an answer that I had to do it myself.  
When I came to reception,  Damian was there with another colegue, not alone, and no one even thought to apologize for the inconvenience.
 I really do not recommend this hotel. Feel very disappointed and cheated.

Review Title: Good location, quiet rooms but very small in size and the staff were not nice
Negative Reviews: staff and house keepers
Positive Reviews:
Clean rooms 
but unfriendly staff

Stayed while I was visiting The Chelsea Flower Show with my wife. 
 Property and location were actually very nice. I would have actually have a good review until post check out event’s which is where the problems started. 

Due to a small spill of soft drink on the end of the bed - they charged me €70 directly to my card post check out. The rooms are extremely small and it is easy to knock things over. 

Upon appeal to the hotel, they accused myself and my wife of urinating on the bed. When I challenged this with the truth and asked them to retract the accusation, they then accused us of having multiple opened and unopened beer cans in the room to try and validate their false accusation. They did not repay the money they took. 

In simple terms they charge you a security fee when you check in and then use this to extract more money if there any minor mishaps in the room. 

So if you are planning to book, be very clear of what’s in scope for this security fee, which is not clearly announce when you book and pay in full. Ensure you don’t have any minor spills etc while you are staying or they will charge you large sums of money with no grounds for appeal!
Interesting when you look into their low star reviews, the vast majority are linked to issues with this security fee. Dishonest at a minimum.
