Review Title: I would absolutely never step foot on this property again.
Negative Reviews: The room was small, constantly damp with mold growing on the ceiling in the shower, the staff was unfriendly, bordering on cold and indifferent, and there is a young boys school next door that is incredibly loud with the sound of screaming children from 7 am to 4 pm. This wouldn’t be an issue IF the hotel didn’t have VERY thin walls, which also lead to “noise complaints” (I.e. people talking at a normal volume).

Review Title: Was decent but I wouldn’t consider it a 4 star hotel.
Negative Reviews: Pillows were terrible, bed was hard as rock, room was tiny for two people. Our room was below the entrance of the hotel so you could hear all the luggage when people entered the hotel. For having stayed there for quite a few nights, would have thought we would be given a better room. We literally had an English basement room right under the lobby
Positive Reviews: Loved the location. And the bathroom/ shower.

Negative Reviews: Reception staff when checking in were not very helpful, he just gave me a card for my room without providing any additional information regarding hotel amenities etc. The hotel is also split into separate buildings similar to old town houses so be aware you may be given a ground floor room on the street. Not a terrible hotel but definitely not deserving of a 4 star title.
Positive Reviews: Very close to tube station, great location.

Negative Reviews: Nothing really.   One must go to the house at #18 to check in/out.

Spotless, quiet, comfortable, near tube station, safe location, good wifi
Great breakfast in nice room.
Nice class of guests, helpful staff.
Convenient

Negative Reviews: I reserved April 8-9 as an additional night for my next consecutive 12 nights (April 9-21), because I am arriving on April 9 early in the morning, earliest check in should be after 8 am, I understand policy is rigid, therefore, I email the hotel directly telling them my condition, and asked them not to cancel my room after 12 midnight per their policy. So that I can take my rest even after 9am in the morning on the check-out day since the booking continues from April 9-21. But I was told when I checked in, you are supposed to check in after 3, front desk staff didn’t even check the whole situation. Very disappointed for the first impression!
Positive Reviews: Only the location

Review Title: Convenient to everywhere may be the only pros for this hotel.
Negative Reviews:
If you are not staying at the reception building where you check in, you have to go ins and outs, ups and downs for your breakfast, with all the hassles taping your card in and out, pushing and pulling the heavy doors of both entrance, not to mention your own room, mine is a heavyweight door just to open it will get me exhausted! No fun at all! Super TINY bathroom is an eye opener! Deluxe double room? I understand this is London, but still it’s not worth for what I am paying for. A very uncomfortable hotel room. The one facing the street seems better. 
Not recommended for seniors with walking conditions, because you also have to go to the basement for your breakfast. If you don’t want cleaning, you have to set on a daily basis or the light will be off on your door, what a design! Expecting guests remember to turn on and off?! Been in one hotel, also have this kind of system, but once you turn on the light, it lasts for as long as you want until you want someone to clean your room. Such a tiny area, just don’t want anyone to mess up my own stuff everyday. I had enough of the place that I forfeit the last night and moved to the airport hotel where I can enjoy a much more spacious room before saying goodbye to London.
Positive Reviews: Only the location,  because of the convenience, easy access to restaurants, convenience stores etc.

Negative Reviews: Comfort of the bed as it was way too hard. I booked breakfast but could not eat there as the service only started at 8am and not good at all for business travellers.

Negative Reviews: Staff at reception was very rude
Positive Reviews: We liked the breakfast and toilet flush

Review Title: Don’t go, especially if you’re a solo female traveller
Negative Reviews:
Would put 0 stars if I could. Avoid at all costs, and if you go beware of their practices! Only location was ok lol

First there is a 100£ deposit to be made without this being disclosed anywhere. But looking at the room’s quality and size, I am not sure what this deposit is for. Definitely not the standard of a 4 stars hotel at this price!! 

On top of that, staff is rude (especially male staff). I honestly don’t get why they’re working there seeing how rude they are with clients. Don’t ask questions at risk of annoying them and not being helped at all! 

Electricity was not working in my room and I have to shower in a 12 degrees appartement (what am I paying for?).

And worst of all, as a solo female traveller, I didn’t feel safe AT ALL while staying there! When I told them the electricity was not working, they wouldn’t give me a new room. They told me I had to wait for 30min but it was already midnight! They asked me to go back to my room and said they didn’t need to be in the room to fix it. So I went to bed and then someone rang at my door just before 1am. The person insisted on coming in my room to fix the problem!! The second night I’m back late as well only to realise the electricity problem is there AGAIN! They didn’t apologise or did any kind of gesture and I had to have someone again in my room around midnight, alone!

Lastly, I did put the “don’t enter” sign the whole day but I know someone got in my room (without cleaning it!!) because the kettle that I unplugged in the morning was plugged when I came back and I am sure of it. If not for cleaning then why would someone enter my room? I do not trust this hotel AT ALL.

Be very careful if you go!!
Positive Reviews: Location nothing else is worth it

Negative Reviews: The noise, I was on lower ground, with what I assume was the boiler next to my vent. I asked to me moved and didn’t even need to mention my room so as I mentioned noise they knew.
Positive Reviews: Nice room and a nice area

Negative Reviews: Uncomfortable bed, ended up with a back pain. They just joined 2 single beds together which kept moving around. The room was cold and could not fix the heating. Very noisy too as you can easily hear the other guests and plumbing. Cramped tight bathrooms. Rooms had a stale smell as if no fresh air can get in. TV and internet were useless too.
Positive Reviews: Convenient location

Review Title: Not the best option. There are other options in the surrounding
Negative Reviews:
Stuff not cooperating they keep turning off the heating I believe to save energy. You must call every hour to make them turn it on from the central control as the switch in the room don’t work. 
Check the room before you move your luggage in  as they will give you a different room and when you complain they will say no problem come tomorrow and check out at 11 then will check you in at 3 pm so I will waste a whole day of your trip. 
You will need to ask them to activate the Elevator as well. 
They fixed the fridge next day. 
They are used to guest complains and shouting. You will find a note that they won’t tolerate guests cursing the stuff.
Positive Reviews: Located near station

Negative Reviews: Everything, worst hotel in London
Positive Reviews: Nothing

Review Title: Potentially an 'off-day', but sadly an awful experience for us.
Negative Reviews:
- We were given a room on the LG floor, and the corridor and room smelt of drains. When we asked the staff, they said it was 'carpet cleaner' that we could smell. However, every available power outlet featured an Ambi Pur plug-in, which would suggest they are very aware of the problem
- The lobby was a free-for-all with left luggage... there were dozens of suitcases just out for anyone to take. Guests were routing for their luggage in these piles of luggage. (This completely put us off asking them to hold our luggage)
- There were sweet wrappers on the floor directly under the toilet bowl, suggesting the bathroom floor had not been swept or cleaned properly
- The housekeeping staff walked into the room in the morning, whilst we were in bed, without knocking or announcing themselves, which was completely unacceptable 
- When we raised these complaints above, the staff offered no sincere apology, resolution or compensation
Positive Reviews: Good location and was 'cheap' for a London hotel, but I would rather pay more to avoid the issues we had.

Negative Reviews:
The heater doesn't work,
lift doesn't work we need to carry 30 kg. luggage up the stairs to 3rd floor

Our room was out the back in the gardens and it was absolutely freezing. There was a draft coming in through the door all night, and the noise from the area meant we couldnt sleep. The rooms are extremely small also. Value for money isnt great in my opinion
Positive Reviews: Location was really good & we were close to everything

Negative Reviews:
Thé staff was absolutely non friendly and rude. They never tried to understand you. You have to ask for toiletries (slippers and brush) on your own, since they do not put it themselves. Moreover, the size of the room was far away small that it should be. We stayed at Deluxe room as our friend, but his room was much bigger. Also, the lift did not worked for 4 days out of our 5 days, we had to claim the second floor every time, which is not easy for my friend. The level of cleaning is not high, since first night we found  a hair on our bed. 
They do not work 24/7 as stated earlier, you have to just to leave the keys on the desk if you leave early, no further instructions and assistance. 
Room was a bit cold and stuff did not tried to help us with this problem, they only said 25 degree is maximum, which in turn did not feel like 25. 
We asked for iron, it took 30 minutes to give us non working one. It was so old, like it is my grand grand mothers iron. Then we asked for another, they brought it in 20 minutes. It did not iron either. Overall 1 hour for nothing. 
When you call reception they are always busy and never call you back.
Positive Reviews: Location and almost clean rooms. That is all good stuff to say about our staying.

Review Title: Nice location yet brought down by average customer service
Negative Reviews:
When checking in staff made me feel uncomfortable due to their behaviour and insensitive jokes, also we were made to feel uncomfortable due to the same staff member leaving earphones in while on a phone call while checking us in. 

Noise pollution due to the primary school next door 

Cutlery in the room was incredibly dirty and lack of hairdryer was disappointing
Positive Reviews: Location very nice

Review Title: A nice hotel let down by some of its staff. Excellent breakfast and nice rooms.
Positive Reviews:
The staff was a real mixed bag, some very good and some not so good. 
Breakfast was very good and the staff at breakfast were excellent. The hotel let down by some of its reception staff, one was clearly lying about a taxi we had asked to be booked, claiming it had arrived despite the fact we were all outside the building with our bags waiting. We got the tube as it had made us 15 minutes late. 
We arranged a room upgrade via booking.com but it was not processed by the hotel who denied having received it.

Negative Reviews: Very small space. Also the entire time we were staying there, the place felt so dusty even after having it cleaned

Negative Reviews: I was charge £100 for damage to the room when there was a crack in the makeup mirror on my arrival. Very disappointed to have been blamed for this
Positive Reviews: Location to tube

Negative Reviews:
Despite we paid more than 200£ per night by booking months earlier, they assigned us a room in the basement of a secondary building.
We asked for a different solution also pleading to take into consideration my state of pregnancy and the discomfort that it would have created to me to stay in a room without natural light and poor air exchange.
What was really disappointing was the response we got from the staff, that was completely inappropriate and rude.
They went from dening any possible alternatives, to writing us in the late morning of the next day telling us that if we wanted a different solution we would have had to come back to the hotel in 15 minutes, to starting arguing with us via email stating false things that other members of the staff allegedly proposed us despite none of them wanted to share their names to allow us to have any kind of reference about who we were discussing with.
At the end, due to the lack of alternatives and the short stay (2 nights) we had to remain, but we will surely never come back.
In attachment a couple of pictures taken in the morning that show the natural light level in the room and the view.
Positive Reviews: Good location and very nice area.

Review Title: the staff were rude and unfriendly. wont recommend this hotel, but the location is good.
Negative Reviews:
most of the staff were unfriendly, disinterested and one or two were rude. this is was not just  our experience, but we were in the lobby when other clients checking out expressed their unhappiness with the poor attitude and indifference of the reception staff.
our poorest experience related to plumbing (no draining in the shower, then a loo overflowing) we were told not to put toilet paper in the loo! the staff claimed that london hotels do not want clients putting toilet paper in the loo as it couldnt flush - but ive travelled from berlin to budapest, cape town to cairo, and NOWHERE did i ever have this experience of not being able to use the loo properly.
Positive Reviews: the location is good, easy access to many tourist favourite spots, such has HydePark, Harrods, and a decent High Street with local pubs and restaurants.

Negative Reviews: staff were awful. like genuinely awful. so rude.
Positive Reviews: Bathroom and shower was lovely.

Review Title: Smelly room, uncomfortable, paper thin bedding - warning!!!!! Don't stay here!!!!!
Negative Reviews:
The room was very small, and the window didn't close and lock correctly. The window didn't keep any noise from outside out! It might as well of had no window.

The bathroom had a very bad smell from the moment we entered the room. It was down to stagnant water and poor drainage. It was stinking!!! Really bad. We asked to change rooms but they were not able to accommodate this request. The hotel did however send a technician up to check on the smell in the bathroom. He said it might have been the cleaning product. What a joke!! I said I wish I could smell cleaning products, it smells like a  open sespit!!

The bed was such poor quality, from the rock hard springy mattress to the paper thin duvet and pillows. It was like lying down on the street!!

I did speak with the staff, several times without any help provided.
I asked to speak to the manager and was told he wasn't available until the next morning. The staff member I spoke to even tried to call him without any response.

We actually changes our flight times to leave a day early atcan additional cost as we were that sick and tired, we just wanted to go home. I have tried to discuss the issues with booking.com and the hotel without any support from either. I wouldn't stay in this hotel again and wouldn't use booking.com again. I'm sorry but how is my experience acceptable???
It's a total joke to be honest.
Positive Reviews: The shower was the only thing about the hotel that was actually quite good. In fact it was very good.

Negative Reviews: The attitude of the staff was so rude and there was no effort to anticipate. Very poor product, we were given a room in the garden.

Room size was small
Staff were rude
Breakfast was in another building.

Negative Reviews: Some really loud plumbing in the property. You could hear water rushing down the soil stack whenever anyone above had a shower or used the toilet. Woke us up both mornings earlier than we planned to get up.

Positive Reviews: The staff were helpful the décor was good and the rooms were modern and had everything you need for a one night stay. Good location for sightseeing, near restaurants coffee shops and bars, as well as local shops.

Review Title: Could have been a very nice stay if it wasn’t for those things

What ruined our stay completely was we stayed in the basement. The stairs outside to our basement window were used by the cleaners to put laundry there.

Lastly you do not have control over aircon and need to keep calling front desk for changes to temp.

Review Title: Unprofessional staff, smelly rooms but nice location
Negative Reviews:
The staff was very rude, super pretentious and disrespectful to customers, they acted like they owned everything, no smiles, no politeness from them. 
The room wasn’t tidied and cleaned frequently, but when they cleaned it, the main items were not left (shampoo, body wash, etc.).
The room we got was on the ground floor and there was a really disgusting and unbearable smell coming from the bathroom, we did tell the reception, but nothing was done about it, we were not offered another option, they only said maybe it’s from the cleaning, but they did not look to understand further about it.
Reception was unattended all evening, so whenever we need something and we called or walked to it, no one was there to attend us. 
To sum it up, really rude staff, very unprofessional and not helpful at all. Smelly rooms. The value for money was just not there.

Negative Reviews: A little bit noisy
Positive Reviews: The individual room is perfect to travel alonw

Negative Reviews: Very small rooms with small beds. Uncomfortable for a couple

Negative Reviews: Bottled water was only supplied on the first day. Providing 2-3 bottles per day should not be problem given the price asked.
Positive Reviews: Location and breakfast. I have asked for adjacent rooms. They were able to at least locate us in the same building. This was helpful by the front desk personel.

Negative Reviews: They could have given me the room I paid extra to get.

Review Title: The customer is always wrong in this awful hotel
Negative Reviews:
The staff and the manager are unlike anything I've ever encountered. They have complete disdain for their customers and no sense of service or honor. They will straight up lie to your face and gaslight you about even the simplest things. Their first reaction is always to reflexively blame the guest.
When our room wasn't cleaned two days in a row they said we must have pushed the do not disturb button. When we told them of silverfish in the sink they said they don't have a pest problem. When we complained repeatedly about the air conditioning they either said it was working fine or we must be pressing the wrong buttons. The broken air conditioning was actually pumping hot air into the tiny room despite being set to 19C, and we couldn't get the temp below 28 degrees, even on cool nights (a KitKat melted).
To fall asleep we had to leave an open basement window which felt unsafe and nasty. We slept under wet towels on the last night because at that point we couldn't even turn off the blasted air conditioning so the open window didn't even help. They will probably respond and say they offered us a room change which they did, but only reactively on the last day when I complained once more, and while also saying that someone was coming to look at the aircon. What they didn't tell us was that the aircon for our floor specifically was broken and they'd known it all along. I learned of this after camping the lobby to talk to the hiding manager post checkout. The manager then admitted the malfunction and said they had been waiting for a spare part to fix the system. I was also there when the maintenance guy came to the lobby and talked about the malfunction, confirming it would be "warm down there" until it was fixed.
The manager promised to E mail me to discuss this further (probably just to get me out the door) and never did. I E mailed the hotel after a few days and got a ridiculous response with more lies and deflections.
Positive Reviews:
EDIT 16 AUG:
The hotel has responded to this review with multiple bold faced lies just as expected. 
1. I had two seperate back-to-back bookings because I extended our stay in London by 2 days BEFORE arrival. I would NEVER have extended at the Merit after staying there but was stuck with the booking unfortunately.
2. We were NOT upgraded. We stayed in a tiny basement room the whole time, a classic double which is what we booked I tried to get help on premises multiple times as they well know, but it was impossible and incredibly frustrating as they were consistently dishonest and defensive as outlined in this review below.
3. I didn't ask for compensation upon returning home. I did so in the lobby, in person, TO THE MANAGER. He said he had to get permission from his boss who was in Egypt and that he would E mail me soon after accepting my hand written contact details (what kind of hotel manager doesn't have authority to decide on refunds?)
4. I'm still waiting for a reply from the nameless hotel manager I E mailed on the 19th of July. Maybe he should reply to E mails instead of writing lies about his customers online.

These people are shameless crooks.

Review Title: Room not cleaned after asking for it to be cleaned on 3 occasions and being told of course Madam.
Negative Reviews: I asked for my room to be cleaned 3 times and it wasn't . I complained later that night when i got back, but nothing was mentioned on check out by  the staff.
Positive Reviews: Location only

Negative Reviews:
Never have I ever felt so humiliated and unwelcome in a hotel. I booked this hotel based on positive reviews and the central location.

From the point of check in, the stay has been problematic. I was initially advised that my requested for a mid-floor room away from lifts/stairs was accommodated for. On arrival, the room I got did not meet any of these needs. Luckily, I was allocated a different room.

The second evening, I went downstairs to request a pair of scissors - only to be abruptly advised that I needed to use it on the spot. Well, of course, I wasn't going to take the pair of scissors away from the front desk. The demeanour of William and his front desk colleagues left me absolutely ashamed at the desk. When I called from my room to ask to speak to a Manager, I was refused. William also refused to give me a name to escalate the matter to. So, I have resorted to this review.

My experience of the front desk team has been totally negative. They are unkind, unhelpful, judgemental and quite frankly, lack soft skills.

In my experience, the customer service aspect of a hotel drives people back to its premises. Sadly, this hotel lacks any of that. Shame - because the location is perfect.

I won't be returning.
Positive Reviews: Besides location and ease of access to the train station, there was very little to like about this hotel.  This was an awkward uncomfortable stay!

Review Title: Size of room ruined the stay.
Negative Reviews: the size of the room was disgusting, suitcases had to be placed on bed to open them. No room to place any clothes.
Positive Reviews: Clean and well appointed

Review Title: If you want to say in charming  Kensington area stay in the less expensive and much more pleasant London Lodge
Negative Reviews: A little noisy at night as you could hear the screech of brakes at nearby tube station but not bad. We stayed near reception desk. The reception area always chaotic— luggage all over the place as they apparently have no luggage storage area. Our primary complaint was the surly staff. There were two pillows on each bed and they were very flat and hard. Our request for a third pillow was flatly denied: “Two is enough”. Our request for a third bath towel each day yielded only additional hand towels.
Positive Reviews: Clean, modern, nice shower. Close to underground

Negative Reviews:
We were in the courtyard outside in rooms 307 & 308.

Room 308 the plugs did not work and the air conditioning unit would blow cold air but then turn to hot.
Room 307 the air conditioning did not work at all and when they tried to fix it, it still did not work but also made 308 not work either.

On the first day we asked reception to look into this; on our return to the hotel it was still not working, we complained to reception and asked to move rooms, they could not move us, whilst I appreciate the hotel was full, we paid for an air conditioning room and they did not apologise and we had to push to get someone to even try and look at it, someone came to the room to look, pressed the same buttons as we had and said he would be bsck, he did not return, we had also asked for a fan what he said he would go and look for, again he did not return.

The second day of the trip we again asked at reception for them to look into the air con, they did not to our knowledge as that evening it was still not working, we asked multiple times to speak to the manager, there was also others unhappy with not having air conditioning.

As our rooms were next to each other we asked for the adjoining door to be opened to try and spread ventilation.

They would not do this at first, but then agreed.
They also told us not to touch the air conditioning control in our room, but as it was blowing hot air we did for a short while, they then came back and turned it on in room 308 and we had the door open to 307 to air it through, but this meant the people who were in 308 were freezing and the people in 307 were still warm.

The staff throughout were very unhelpful, did not once apologise and made it that it was our fault the air conditioning was not working.

On the morning of check out, which is 11am the maid came and rang the bell at 9.30am we said we were staying until check out, she then came back again at 10.30 and we again said we would not be leaving until 11 at 10.
Positive Reviews: The location was good.

Review Title: Truly disappointing and extremely expensive overnight stay ..... and I had to leave a £100 deposit!
Negative Reviews:
More explicit directions to our room when we arrived at 10.45pm: dealing with an extremely heavy suitcase which we had to lug out of one building and along to another, up steps, down step, outside again to eventually finding our room.
The electrics in the room had obviously been tripped prior to our arrival: no working kettle and no ability to charge phones.
I then discovered that the electric kettle was leaking. It took the Management 20 mins to sort this problem (with two attempts to replace the kettle). I booked a twin bedded room and we were allocated a double.  I took a photo of the existing damage to the room's wall.
Room was so small for the amount we payed for it. Could barely move about and not really anywhere to put luggage.

Negative Reviews: My Deluxe room  was situated at the basement, literally next to the fire exit, which guests from the same level seemed to have preferred using over the main entrance because there were no stairs to climb. On top of that, the door mechanism works like a magnet to a metal - every time you close the door it slams extremely loudly. Already on the first morning I was woken up at 5am by people who were checking out and had the door got shut in its natural smacking loud way. About 3 hours later, a little past 8AM I was woken up again from the next wall this time. Apparently my room was neighbouring some sort of renovation/carpentry room where workers would always start hammering between 08-08:30am. I cannot understand how thin the walls must be but the noise was unbearable. I banged back on the wall  but of course, that didn't help because the workers are simply doing their job. I was thinking of asking the reception to change my room but I had only few days in London and losing time moving from one room to another when it is ready, usually at 3pm, was very invconvenient and therefore not an option. The renovation work would wake me up every morning with the same hammering and then drilling. But that's provided I didnt get woken up at night by people coming back from the ciry or cleaning ladies coming to work and busing arou d their service room which literally two steps away from my door. On top of that the room is extremely dark, the only window there is facing the exit door where everyone is walking as well as some store units are placed, where service people keep circling. These basement rooms and specifically the ones near the fire exit door and renovation room, should not be even an option to use for clients. Not to even talk about the ridiculous amount of money they charge us.....
Positive Reviews: The hotel is located right next to a metro station. The bed and the pillows are really comfortable. Too bad it was impossible to enjoy sleeping in there due to constant noise from both the exit door and the renovation room from a neighbouring wall.

Negative Reviews:
I was deeply disappointed by the behavior of a hotel employee who entered our room without knocking while we were still inside, despite the fact that the "Do Not Disturb" sign was turned on and we could clearly be heard inside the room. 

This incident occurred three hours before the official checkout time, and there was no need for anyone to enter the room without permission. We were paying customers who deserved to be treated with respect and courtesy.

The fact that the hotel employee showed such a lack of consideration is unacceptable and reflects poorly on the hotel's standards. 

I urge the management to take appropriate action to ensure that such incidents do not occur again in the future. Customers should be able to enjoy their stay without fear of their privacy being violated by unprofessional and inconsiderate staff members.

Review Title: Great facilities/location, strange deposit policy, maybe a bit more attention to special requests.
Negative Reviews: The fact that the venue charged a £100 deposit (after payment had already been taken) was really quite odd. This is exceptionally rare and something we'd expect in renting an apartment, not staying for two nights. Not even 5* hotels do this. We also had a number of special requests unfulfilled. 1) early check-in request was made with a response stating that we were on a "priority list," however when my partner arrived early he was offered a rather dismissive response of "3.30pm - it might be available earlier but no guarantees" - leaving him stranded and jetlagged in London. 2) we requested in advance not to be on the ground/basement floor but ended up being in the basement. If we are to be put in the basement we might expect a slightly cheaper price.
Positive Reviews: Property was very clean, bed was comfortable and close to the Earl's Court tube station. The complimentary toiletries were also nice, and the safe was big enough to fit all of our valuables. I also liked the custom lighting which allowed for adjusting lighting levels to one's taste, which was a nice touch! All in all it was very well-furnished especially in the context of London hotels which are often rather dated buildings - this was really quite nice overall.

Review Title: Acceptable Rooms with rude and u professional staff
Negative Reviews:
We arrived on the 18th of December at the Merit Kensington and stayed three nights.
 When we arrived the lobby was literally CROWDED and we were asked to wait outside. Not a problem for me even though it was pouring. When we were finally asked to come in for check-in we were asked to surrender a visa card. When we submitted one  it (somehow) was not compatible with their card reader. But instead of the staying calm.... the staff was really pissed and impatient- not very professional from my point of view since we had already paid 1400£ in advance for our rooms.
After several tries it finally worked.

We had booked three rooms and had asked for them to be close to each other (same floor maybe).  Two rooms, however, were located in the garden and when we asked for a change since we wanted to be close together (and still we had paid good money) eyes were rolled and no effort was made- not professionell AT ALL. I mean even pretend that you are trying....
But after this start the next problem (of course) arose immediately.
In my room the heater was NOT WORKING AT ALL and it was actually really cold outside ( I mean it was December).. I called the reception several times (to politely ask them so send someone to help) until someone FINALLY came to check on it. One man from the reception came and clicked a bit around in our room but (in my opinion) he didn't have a clue what he was actually doing or supposed to do).
After a few minutes he said it was supposed to heat up in 20min which it definitely didn't. We returned after two hours and still it was not working. The room was cold. Since I paid (like already mentioned) good money I was not willing to be cold/freezing in a hotel room in December.  So I tried it again (always polite and kind) to pls help me get the heater on. Now the receptionist was only annoyed and said maybe we are just too stupid to get the heater working- UNACCEPTABLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Positive Reviews:
I really liked the location of the hotel. It was really close to Earl's Court and the street was really pretty too. 
Cleanliness was alright even though our bed sheets (on the second day) had some stains on them which were definitely not from us. 
The

Negative Reviews:
the room was advertised as "deluxe" with a sitting area. It was actually a microscopic room with no sitting area. The front desk personnel were able to find us an equally small room that was set up in such a way that we were able to maneuver around our suitcases. There was no where to unpack our clothes which, since we were there for more than a week was inconvenient.
When I attempted to address my concerns, the front desk personnel and the manager would not let me get a word in, continually interrupting me and attempting to "mansplain" what European hotel rooms are like. I have travelled around Europe and Asia and know what to expect. I would suggest that advertising sitting areas in rooms where the only place to sit is the bed is false advertising.

Anyway, i did not feel comfortable during my stay at this hotel, even with the good location next to earls court station.

I booked a deluxe and paid for that. They assigned a standard. I complained, pictures clearly showed how a deluxe looked like. But they did all they could to deny and convince me of the opposite. They also took me to another deluxe and again it was a deluxe with no light, facing a wall and not matching the pictures available on line. In the end, I had to stay in the standard room as although it was smaller and various things of the deluxe were missing, at least it had a window facing the street and the light. I travel in the industry and I am still able to know how a room I booked should look like. It's a shame as the hotel is a good hotel, but this definitely won't make me come back.
Also, they take a damage deposit of £100 that honestly does not make much sense if you stay one night only and when you leave they do not check or give you any documentation. I had to ask and make sure no damage was reported after the check and that they showed me the release of the deposit.

I said she was at the desk and gave me a luggage tag and how I would know she was not the right person and that their approach was not professional. Reception informed us that housekeeping had gone home and there was nothing they could do - they showed us other bookings which had added notes, we showed them our booking which clearly said twin beds - eventually they let us have an additional duvet. Review Title: Mixed stay - but if you have an issue no-one will care
Negative Reviews: My daughter's room (228) had a very strong smell of sewage- so bad that they had to ask the night porter to come up. He did so, agreed it was awful and said it had been an issue that couldn't be resolved as the room was always booked. On checkout I complained to reception who weren't bothered and told me to email. The response I had basically denied there was any problem, my daughter had probably removed the cap in the shower (as if) and no one had ever complained. But why would we make it up?! I am not one to usually leave a bad review but the lack of customer service was shocking - no apology at all from anyone. Although my room was fine, this lack of basic customer service spoiled a 21st birthday celebration and the attitude of management will stop me staying here again.

Review Title: Really noisy room when asked for a quiet one.
Negative Reviews:
What's really important to us is peace and quiet. When we stayed last time, for the first time, we asked for a quiet room and got one! Happy days. 
This time I asked for a quiet room and probably couldn't have been given a more noisy room. Right by the lift shaft, below ground, so right by the road AND near the talking door bell and with the laundry right outside the window - literally!
We complained immediately and, even though they were still checking other guests in, they said they couldn't move us. 
If you book weeks in advance and still get a really poor room, you have to wonder if it's as good as we thought last time. 
Probably won't be going back, therefore.

Review Title: Felt VERY duped.  Small, tiny rooms, barely working AC, unfriendly front desk staff.  Stay away

The front desk staff was not friendly or helpful.  At times, they were almost hostile!  Canceled a great booking for this hotel, and felt VERY duped.  Lobby always has a ton of bags for people checking out.  Lobby is small, elevators small, room is like a jail cell.  Want water?  Pay for it besides your ONE free one. Negative Reviews:
first of all, When i check in, they said i have a free upgrade but the room does not have elevator! the elevator is out of order! i am travelling with heavy luggage and an elderly. When i climbed the ladder and reached the room, i found other guests luggage is already inside the room. Clearly they have made a mistake. I climbed again and told them what happened. I dont want my mother climb again and i told her to wait at the door first. They said pls wait a moment and they really made a mistake. 

Mistakes happens and i dont think is a big problem. I said: i dont need a upgrade. please just give me a room with elevator. They just asked me to wait without a single apology. The attitude is so bad - feel like i am the one causing trouble

15 mins passed and my mother still waited at the room door. Both of us dont have the progress. i asked whats happening now and they just said wait! i said my mother is waiting at door step. There is no way she climb ups and downs again. They finally get me a room in another building. I said if anyone free and help me to get the luggage into another building (all buildings has door steps in front door). They said sorry i dont have people who can help.   

ok i carry them by myself to another buildings. First, climbing down from one building and up for another building

When i checked out again (heavy rain outside), no staff show any willingness to help when they see guests struggling with luggages in the door steps. Thank you for the gentleman who is another room guest helping me to get through the steps

i think all the equipments in london hotels is similar but the attitude really makes a hugh difference! i would not stay here again and i recommend who are reading this review think twice on booking it.

Review Title: one of the most horrifying experiences of my life
Negative Reviews:
I would need a lot of space to really say everything about it, but let me begin by clarifying that I work in the travel industry, and this “hotel” did everything like they were in the past century. 
Starting with the fact that the room maids were going into our room even if we used the non-disturb sign, they even threw away things that we did not clear with them that they should. When we pointed out the inconvenience to the reception, they just said that room maids had to go in whether we liked it or not.
From there, they took our first-night deposit even though here in booking I’ve chosen to pay at the property, and when we decided to check out, they were supposed to refund us for the wrongful payment, but they tried to condition that to the room maids doing a double check in the room. Our checkout was around 6 pm, and room maids would stop working earlier than that, which would mean us only getting the refund on the next day, not being in London anymore. Completely unreasonable policy. I had to insist so that the manager would go to the room and check.
Also, we needed new bedsheets as the room maid while “cleaning” the room put pillows that fell on the floor back on the bed, and we wanted to make sure we were using clean pillows. The receptionist refused to help and finally the manager, totally impolitely, gave us only 2. there were four pillows. 
I mean, the guys were so intrusive and not helpful that I decided to check out earlier and go to another place so that I could keep enjoying my stay in London.
Want a suggestion: don’t stay there!
Positive Reviews: I’d say the only thing that was interesting about this property was the fact it was close to the subway station so very easy to navigate through London. Literally 3 minutes from the door (depending on each apartment block they assign you to) to the subway station.

Review Title: Put my luggage in the storage after that tell me pay for storage now. Tell me pay 160 pound for two days.
Negative Reviews: All the staff not too good with customer very bad for everything

utterly terrible. Do not stay here! you’d be better off at a holiday inn. I actually cut my trip short in order to get away from it. 
I was initially checked into the wrong room.. a tiny room in a hell hole of a lower basement that smelt so strongly of chemicals that I dread to think what they were cleaning up. It was impossible to sleep in there. I complained at around 11pm and moved to another room.. which this time smelt strongly of human body odour… as if someone had literally just had sex in it. 
I was just drifting off to sleep (with the window wide open in the middle of winter to rid the place of its foul smell), when the man at reception called at 1am to admit he had actually checked me into the wrong room initially and would not check me into the correct room. I was taken to another disgusting room in the basement which luckily did not smell of anything this time but had a useless patio window that led to a brick wall, a broken mirror, questionable stains and was generally poorly decorated noisy and dire. 
I cut my trip short.. just to escape the place. what a waste of money. you’d have to pay me to stay here again.

They gave me an room in the garden with loud transforms outside my room and I could Not take meetings because of the noise 

While checking in he did not even mention that I was getting an room in the Garden plus in T&Cs they should clarify and booking.com should have ensured to mention that they charge an pre-authorisation of 100 pounds on checking in
The room was a lot smaller than looked also was a awful smell in the room, and when checking out they kept my deposit which they lied about just to achieve

The room we initially booked wasn’t as advertised, it was dirty and much smaller. I did feel claustrophobic the whole time. The hair dryer didn’t work, the heating wasn’t working and we were cold the whole night. I found the window unlocked so I didn’t feel secure being on the basement floor. In addition, it was noisy all night and hard to get any sleep. And in the morning, due to the room being close to the breakfast place, it was very loud and noisy. The cleanliness and noise were the main issues.

We asked for a room change, however, when we came that night to check-in the other room, it smelled of sewage, there was blood stains on the sheets and pillows (which is is a health hazard), large stains on the mattress, and it had a horrible loud noise coming from the drains/ vents. We talked with the staff and asked for a room change, which they said no to due to rooms in the same class being fully booked. We felt uncomfortable staying in this room and were forced to find other alternatives at 9 pm.
The staff were rude and didn’t offer any help. They refused to refund me for both nights. I will never go there again and highly recommend you not no book.
